Reviews.Title: “Great Bar Meals”
Reviews.Author: petasc
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay at the hotel only popped in got a meal on impulse whilst passing. Enjoyed a very well priced roast of the day with all the trimmings. Was delicious though could have been served warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated and with an Olympic pool thrown in!”
Reviews.Author: ABdeMH
Reviews.Content: Yes, thereâ€™s a stunning view from any bedroom (improves slightly as the room number decreases and the floor levels increase). Certainly I spent ten days here and never tired of looking over the busy stretch of water round that â€œcoathangerâ€� bridge. But the hotel is also conveniently next to a station only a couple of stops from the heart of Sydney. A more scenic route is to walk straight down from the hotel to Lavender Bay and along the waterfront to the ferry at Milsomâ€™s Point. North Sydney is quieter than central Sydney, but there is a good choice of restaurants and shops nearby and towards McMahonâ€™s Point. All that and the efficient, welcoming staff made for a more relaxing stay in the City than Iâ€™d expected. The rooms were clean, well stocked and everything worked. The only drawback was having to pay for the internet, which is oh, so yesterday. However, the bonus for me was the hotelâ€™s free access to the nearby Olympic Pool (50 metre, heated, open air, laned swimming pool). This hotel is definitely a great base from which to visit the Sydney essentials.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular view”
Reviews.Author: gsebire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times-great proximity to North Sydney IT companies if travelling on business.Excellent in-house restaurant and bar. Easy access to harbour and North Sydney pool and jogging tracks if you need exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's best kept secret..”
Reviews.Author: BrissyAdventurer
Reviews.Content: Once you have stayed at the Harbour View Hotel in Sydney, you won't wish to stay anywhere else. Fantastic accommodation, showcasing Sydney at its finest - this place is a hidden treasure! It is perfect proximity to North Sydney trains, Circular Quay, Blue's Point Rd, incredible restaurants, and anything you could ever hope to make a Sydney trip complete. The view is like being in a constantly moving picture of thriving, cosmopolitan activity (or an episode of Ferry Boat Fred) - which you have to peel yourself away from to experience the delights of the surrounding area. It's equally hard to peel away from the exceptionally comfortable bedding, the Blue's Bar and in-house restuarant to get out and about! In the words of the great Molly Meldrum, "do yourself a favour" and stay at the Harbour View Hotel. If the sound of trains concerns you, just bring ear plugs - simple!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Swift2097
Reviews.Content: Good view to harbor even sitting on the toilet commode you have the view. Clean enough, Bed is too soft. Room may be worth 100, but another 100 they must be charging for the view. Internet is expensive, $25!. Do not touch anything goodies kept on the shelf in the room...finger might burn....expensive. Last week I had the most expensive cookie in my life; $7.5 for a cookie kept on the coffee mug.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: outdere2
Reviews.Content: no real complaints about the harbour view just that the new beds are ridiculously too soft i know most people like this but not me thats all

Reviews.Title: “With the refurbishment it is now a "must stay" place”
Reviews.Author: BrisCaz
Reviews.Content: I used to often stay at the Harbour View because it was close by our offices in North Sydney but, even with the superb views, I got sick of the old worn out rooms. When I stayed here again recently I was pleasantly surprised. There is a major refurbishment going on and the room I stayed in had just been finished. The beds are fantastic (Rydges "Dream Beds" move over!) and all in all the rooms have been nicely fitted out. So now you have the great view, nice rooms and great beds. The only thing I still dont like about the place is the noise from the train station even though I might be on a high floor but I am particularly sensitive to noise of any sort so that might not bother most people.

Reviews.Title: “Room with an iconic view”
Reviews.Author: kiwibear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recommendation. The Decor is fairly tired and the restaurant food rather average but when you look out your window at the view of the Harbour and the Harbour Bridge - all is forgiven. So ask for a room with a view of lavender bay The rooms are a decent size. Its right next to the train line (ask for a high floor) as the trains run right under the hotel so can be a bit noisy late at night. Proximity to station is good for getting to central Sydney - only three stops. Its in business area so fairly quiet in the evening and weekend - but you so close to central Sydney its no problem. So you can eat out wherever and get back to the hotel easily. So good if you like to see the heart of the city but don't need to be part of it If you time it right its only about 30 minutes from the Airport too. If was coming to Sydney for weekend or a few days would stay here again. Its not a top notch experience, but it is reasonably priced and conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “embarrsed dinning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With dissapointment two guest from Overseas two of us ordered the grain fed scotch fillet. i ordered mine as meduim rare and my guest ordered his well done. to my dissapointment the meal came out i attempted to cut the steak and found it to be like a piece of boot leather and with my exerprince in the food industry i find it very hard to believe that it was scotch fillet let alone grain fed. i then asked for the bill and observed the waiter checking to see if he had been tipped and rasing his eye browes when he saw no tip. what a diisapointment for my guest and myself the bill no was 60037 and cost for the meal was $172.90 for three people.

HotelInfo.Name: Harbour View Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 18 Lower Fort Street | The Rocks, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
